page.title: 18Leeds-Liverpool Canal.
page.content: Our section was built in 1774. At {Spencers Bridge}there are 3 cottages & a swing bridge. By the cottages was a barge called Waterlupin. There were brick & concrete {pillboxes.}An {aqueduct} takes the canal over the {R.Tawd.}We saw dragonflies, butterflies,seagulls,ducks,goats convounlus,Ox eye daisies,red & white clover,buttercups, hawkweed,yellow & blue vetch, rose bay willow herb, cow parsley,grass,thistle,rushes, water lilys, hawthorn, beech and ash trees. Most barges are now pleasure craft, there were also motor boats. The canal is also used by anglers. They catch perch and roach. Mrs Martland lives in one of the bargee's cottages. She has 10 stables & 7 pig sties at the back of her house. The stables were used for the old barge horses. There was a ramp for horses which fell in the canal.
